subject: baremetal element: Enable stable interface names
commit_message:
baremetal element: Enable stable interface names

By default most cloud images have disabled the
udev rules which give us stable network interface names. While
this is a reasonable default for something like EC2 (the target
for these images) this is very bad behavour on bare metal
and can cause a "musical NICs" situation to occur where
on reboot the NIC names get swapped.

In this commit we re-enable stable interface naming by
removing the dev nulled rules softlink and installing
the biosdevname package. Once this is done interface
names should again show up as em1, em2 instead of
the old eth0, eth1.

We also remove some the common, statically configured
eth0 config files on some distributions. Equivalent
files (if needed) may be auto-generated by using
the dhcp-all-interfaces element.

Change-Id: Idd67977342719e2f295e2fa2c0ed6cfa8602171a

Fixed nova VM live migration issue with 3PAR

Nova bypasses the cinder checks for a volume
being available, when it tries to attach a volume
to a new host during live migration.  The assumption
in cinder to this point has been that volumes can only
be attached to one host.  The 3PAR driver worked under
that assumption.  This assumption fell apart during detach
time as the driver was only looking for a VLUN on the
entire 3PAR, since it assumed it could only exist on one host.

This patch ensures that the driver looks for the VLUN on the
hostname it expects.

subject: Recover from REBOOT-* state on compute manager start-up
commit_message:
Recover from REBOOT-* state on compute manager start-up

If a compute manager is stopped / fails during certain REBOOT-*
operations then the instance will be left stuck in a transitional
task_state

This change handles two possible task states REBOOT_PENDING and
REBOOT_STARTED (for both soft and hard reboots). And either clears
these states or retries the reboot depending on the instance state.

Both task states are set after the request has gotten to the compute
manager so we can handle these safely knowing the operation has
ended/failed with the restart of the compute manager.

We retry the reboot where the state is PENDING and where the state is
STARTED and the instance is not running.

Where the instance is running and the state is STARTED we simply
transition the instance to an ACTIVE state. The user can retry the
reboot if required.

Related to blueprint recover-stuck-state

Change-Id: Ib318b3d444a67616441302f3daa8de20ee946f3f

subject: Make ceilometer work with sqla 0.9.x
commit_message:
Make ceilometer work with sqla 0.9.x

Ceilometer's migration 028 makes some very specific assumptions
about sqla data structures and exception paths, which are not
true in sqla 0.9.x. In 0.8 you were shielded from errors on drop
by sqla, but in 0.9 you get raw exceptions from the db layer
thrown all the way up, which causes a failure condition when
trying to delete the non existent alembic table.

We can get basically the same behavior as before by using the
checkfirst=True parameter on table definitions. This will
actually ensure that we get the table in question, and get the
NoSuchTableError when we expect it.

subject: Resource type implementation for software deployment
commit_message:
Resource type implementation for software deployment

Some notes on the implementation:
  * Whenever a config should be deployed, this resource loads the config
    and creates an ephemeral derived config which has the following inputs
    added to it:
    * deploy_server_id
    * deploy_action
    * deploy_stack_id
    * deploy_resource_name
  * When signal_transport=CFN_SIGNAL, the folling input is added:
    * deploy_signal_id
  * When signal_transport=HEAT_SIGNAL, the folling inputs are added:
    * deploy_auth_url
    * deploy_username
    * deploy_password
    * deploy_project_id
    These inputs can be used by the hook *or* by the configuration script
    itself.
  * The ephemeral config also has the current input values inserted into
    the 'value' field of the config inputs. This allows the deployment
    metadata to be a simple list of configs.
  * Subclasses of SoftwareDeployment can make further transformations to
    the ephemeral config, such as transforming the config script to contain
    input values.
  * SoftwareDeployment is a SignalResponder so that it can receive
    output value updates from the server via curl or cfn-signal
  * By default, SoftwareDeployment remains in an IN_PROGRESS state
    until a signal is received
  * If wait_for_signal=False the resource will go immediately to COMPLETE
  * A deployment resource can be configured to deploy on any action.
    By default it deploys on CREATE and UPDATE
  * The outputs deploy_stderr, deploy_stdout and deploy_status_code
    are defined in the attributes schema, but other attributes map to
    whatever outputs are defined for the corresponding config resource

subject: Nova ironic driver to retry on HTTP 503
commit_message:
Nova ironic driver to retry on HTTP 503

The commit 0ddab4236753f33fe5f828afb76f7148fd014b8f fixed the Ironic
API to return HTTP 503 (Service unavailable) when a request can't be
completed because the service was temporary unavailable, before the
API was returning HTTP 409 (Conflict) for such cases. The nova ironic
driver was looking at HTTP 409 in order to retry a request, this commit
fix the retry mechanism on the nova ironic driver making it look at the
HTTP 503 instead.

Change-Id: Ia0ecb40fee55b28a9865def7ba9f8a29afc889ba
